N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 14 ยง 621.2 - Background and intent

State Regulations
(a) Three possible
sources of funds are available for the capital costs (see glossary, section
621.17
of this Part) and other
eligible costs as set forth in this Part of construction or financing for a
community facility for which application can be made to OPWDD. (1)

One source of funds is a grant for State
aid which may be made available to an applicant pursuant to article 41 of the

Mental Hygiene Law. (2)
A mortgage
loan from the New York State Housing Finance Agency (hereinafter referred to as
HFA), made available pursuant to article 75 of the Mental Hygiene

Law. (3)
A mortgage loan from the

New York State Facilities Development Corporation (hereinafter referred to as
FDC) pursuant to subdivision 13-d of section 5 of the Facilities Development

Corporation Act from the proceeds of the sale of tax-exempt bonds and notes
issued by the New York State Medical Care Facilities Finance Agency
(hereinafter referred to as MCFFA) pursuant to such Act, for the purpose of
financing or refinancing the construction, acquisition, reconstruction, rehabilitation or improvement of a community facility. For the purposes of this

Part, such loan from the FDC may include and may be referred to herein, or in
any document relating to such loans, as FDC mortgage loan, FDC loan, or FDC
secured loan. (b) This

Part sets forth the conditions for obtaining a State aid grant, an HFA mortgage
loan, or an FDC mortgage loan to meet the capital and other eligible costs as
set forth herein for the construction or financing of a community
facility. Notes
